intro: Mariosousa heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf mariosousa, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, with leaves ranging from linear to ovate in shape. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in winter, attracting various pollinators. This species is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
